title: The Stephen King Movie Universe, By the Numbers
text:
‘IT Chapter Two’ opened in theaters Friday. Photo: Warner Bros. Pictures

Stephen King has seen many of his books adapted for the screen. Photo: Astrid Stawiarz/Getty Images

Few writers have had their work adapted for the screen as often as Stephen King. “IT Chapter Two,” which opened in theaters Friday, is at least the 43rd movie inspired by his books, according to Box Office Mojo. That’s about one a year since the first adaptation, “Carrie,” was released in 1976.

Led by the earlier “IT” movie in 2017, about a killer clown, these King films entered the weekend having grossed about $2.7 billion in the U.S., adjusted for inflation, according to Box Office Mojo. That’s nearly six times the value of the annual lobster catch in Maine, where many of the books and movies are set.
